name: Crowdsale

@title SafeMath
@dev Math operations with safety checks that throw on error
attributes.name: SafeMath

attributes.documentation: @dev Multiplies two numbers, throws on overflow.
attributes.name: mul

attributes.documentation: @dev Integer division of two numbers, truncating the quotient.
attributes.name: div

attributes.documentation: @dev Subtracts two numbers, throws on overflow (i.e. if subtrahend is greater than minuend).
attributes.name: sub

attributes.documentation: @dev Adds two numbers, throws on overflow.
attributes.name: add

attributes.documentation:
@dev The Ownable constructor sets the original `owner` of the contract to the sender
account.
@dev Throws if called by any account other than the owner.
attributes.name: onlyOwner
renounceOwnership

attributes.documentation:
@dev Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.
@param _newOwner The address to transfer ownership to.
attributes.name: transferOwnership

attributes.documentation:
@dev Transfers control of the contract to a newOwner.
@param _newOwner The address to transfer ownership to.
attributes.name: _transferOwnership
MintableToken
mint

attributes.documentation:
@dev Function to stop minting new tokens.
@return True if the operation was successful.
attributes.name: finishMinting
HasNoEther

attributes.documentation:
@dev Constructor that rejects incoming Ether
The `payable` flag is added so we can access `msg.value` without compiler warning. If we
leave out payable, then Solidity will allow inheriting contracts to implement a payable
constructor. By doing it this way we prevent a payable constructor from working. Alternatively
we could use assembly to access msg.value.
@dev Disallows direct send by settings a default function without the `payable` flag.
@dev Transfer all Ether held by the contract to the owner.
attributes.name: reclaimEther
SafeERC20
CanReclaimToken

attributes.documentation:
@dev Reclaim all ERC20Basic compatible tokens
@param token ERC20Basic The address of the token contract
attributes.name: reclaimToken
HasNoTokens
tokenFallback
HasNoContracts

attributes.documentation:
@dev Reclaim ownership of Ownable contracts
@param contractAddr The address of the Ownable to be reclaimed.
attributes.name: reclaimContract
NoOwner

attributes.documentation: Allow transfer only after crowdsale finished
attributes.name: canTransfer

attributes.documentation: @notice Sell tokens directly, without referral bonuses

attributes.name: getTokensForValue

attributes.documentation: @notice If crowdsale is running
attributes.name: crowdsaleOpen

attributes.documentation:
@notice Calculates how many tokens are left to sale
@return amount of tokens left before hard cap reached
attributes.name: getTokensLeft

attributes.documentation: @dev Helper function to mint tokens and increase tokensMinted counter
attributes.name: mintTokens

attributes.documentation: @notice Sends all contributed ether back if minimum cap is not reached by the end of crowdsale
attributes.name: refund

attributes.documentation: @notice Closes crowdsale, finishes minting (allowing token transfers), transfers token ownership to the owner
attributes.name: finalizeCrowdsale

attributes.documentation: @notice Claim collected ether without closing crowdsale
